title: Division by infinity
summary: In mathematics, division by infinity is division where the divisor (denominator) is infinity. In ordinary arithmetic, this does not have a well-defined meaning, since infinity is a mathematical concept that does not correspond to a specific number, and moreover, there is no nonzero real number that, when added to itself an infinite number of times, gives a finite number. However, "dividing by infinity" can be given meaning as an informal way of expressing the limit of dividing a number by larger and larger divisors.[1]: 201–204
